Authors:
Melissa Palacio, Rosa Mara Silveira, Gerardo Lucio
Robledo
Title:
Neofavolus subpurpurascens comb. nov. and new records from
Neotropics
Abstract:
Polyporus subpurpurascens is a neotropical, rare, and
remarkable species by its deep purplish pilear surface and its radially
elongated pores. Neotropical specimens from Argentina, Bolivia and
Brazil were studied, applying a detailed macro- and micromorphological
examination, and phylogenetic analyses using the nuclear ribosomal
internal transcribed spacer (nrITS) and nuclear ribosomal large subunit
(nrLSU). Morphological and phylogenetic analysis, led us to conclude
that P. subpurpurascens represent a Neofavolus species. Neofavolus
subpurpurascens is proposed as a new combination; new records for the
species are presented as well as a detailed description and photos.
